question: The Global Cyber Security Index (GCI) is released by:
explanation: The Global Cyber security Index (GCI) is released by International Telecommunication Union (ITU). It is a multi-stakeholder initiative to measure the commitment of countries to cyber security. Cyber security has a wide field of application that cuts across many industries and sectors. Each countryâ€™s level of development will therefore be analyzed within five categories: Legal Measures, Technical Measures, Organizational Measures, Capacity Building and Cooperation. India has been ranked 23rd out of 165 nations in the Global Cyber security Index (GCI) 2017.
